name: Hartmanis–Stearns conjecture
summary:
In theoretical computer science and mathematics, the Hartmanis–Stearns conjecture is an open problem named after Juris Hartmanis and Richard E. Stearns, who posed it in a 1965 paper that founded the field of computational complexity theory (earning them the 1993 ACM Turing Award).
An infinite word is said to be real-time computable when there exists a multitape Turing machine which (run without input) writes the successive letters of the word on its output tape, taking a bounded amount of time b
kwds: Diophantine approximation and transcendental number theory
